reviews.review: TOP GAME))

The game is Valve's tribute to Quake. The gameplay is similar to Quake with all the same weapons and pickups except for the Half-Life's trademark crowbar as a melee weapon. The game is very fun to play and you can get into it pretty easily. Learning some of the most advanced techniques mimicked from Quake such as bunnyhopping can be tough to learn but other than that the game is not hard at all to play. However, the game doesn't really have that many active players and you won't have the same kind of fun playing it as Valve's other titles. On the whole, the game is fun but gets repetitive later on.

Valve gave Quake deathmatch a makeover, and now nobody plays it. If you have enough friends who bought it in a collection you can badger into playing with you, or if you find a server with bots, you'll probably be alright. The game itself is okay I guess, although kind of janky, since it's a remake of Quake in an engine that itself is a heavily modified version of Quake's engine meant for somewhat more realistic games like Half-Life. If you plan on playing something like this semi-regularly you're really just better off playing an actual Quake game; this is more of a tribute-turned-curiosity by now.

A decent Quake-like arena shooter that suffers from a severe lack of players. During primetime in the US, there are usually just enough people online to fill a single server, but other than that, you're pretty much left on your own to experience a brilliant open-ended walking simulator that serves as an artsy exploration of how we abandon our virtual worlds whenever the newest, shiniest, lens flare-iest game comes out told through the most innovative environmental storytelling of the time period. It's an odd combination of genres, sure, but the transition between pretentious indie game and classic late-90s multiplayer action is absolutely seamless.

7/10 - like Dear Esther with guns

This is like the remastered version of Quake 1 Multiplayer mod or QuakeWorld. The model textures and geometry polygon count have been increased for its smoothness. Plus most servers have Metamod 3rd party support and bots to make DMC servers live longer than Quake 1 servers. If you own a dedicated server for CS 1.6 and like to try host DMC, go ahead. 

Don't bother using HPB_Bots as they are too sluggish and incompetant, but try RCBot v1.442-beta out. However RCBot got some complicated configurations, but it's useful for your bot to work various ways.

Deathmatch classic is as the name suggest a classic both in game style and graphics. In the modern pc era filled with squeakers and russians. This game i feel gives a more serious community which is more forgiving and alot more friendly. Deathmatch classic was made with the quake engine which means it can run on any potato pc something i can relate to that with my potato pc. I think Deathmatch classic is a fun and enjoyable fps which changed alot of meta for the fps to follow. 

I highly recommend this game because i feel that the community deserves some more respect because they are a part of making this game what it is.

If you're tired of squeakers and russians welcome... To Deathmatch classic.

10/10 would play again ^-^
